input_text:
Job Title: EFO Engineer

Location: Atlanta, GA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Newell Brands is a leading $8.5B consumer products company with a portfolio of iconic brands such as Graco®, Coleman®, Oster®, Rubbermaid® and Sharpie®, and 28,000 talented employees around the world. Our high-performance culture, unparalleled curiosity about the world around us, and talented people fuel our success. Our culture is enabled through our core values which guide all we do and how we win as One Newell. They are Integrity, Teamwork, Passion for Winning, Ownership & Leadership.

Job Summary

The evolution of the Newell Brands Supply Chain includes a focus on driving productivity through building capability in people, processes, and technology. PEAK (Planning, Engagement, Achievement, Knowledge), Newell’s branded improvement strategy, is fundamental to that goal. A Center of Excellence with a deep competency in implementing PEAK PACS (Processes, Applications, Capabilities, and Systems) in Supply-Chain and Transactional settings is a crucial element in our future success. PEAK and the EFO PACS are embedded with traditional TPM, LEAN, and 6 Sigma principles. The EFO engineer is responsible for driving the deployment and maintenance of the standards for the EFO PACS which is based on the TPM AM, PM, EM and FI pillars and principles. The EFO engineer will work with the corporate personnel, plant managers and maintenance managers building skills and capabilities across teams. The EFO engineer will also monitor and report on the performance and progress of EFO activities, identify and share best practices, and provide coaching and training to regional teams and facilitate training sessions.

Key Responsibilities

 Assist EFO Manager in development and implementation of the AM roadmap and action plan for North America, in alignment with the global EO framework and regional priorities. Support the AM assessments at each plant and provide feedback and recommendations for improvement. Facilitate the sharing of AM knowledge and best practices across the region and leverage the AM network and resources to solve problems and drive continuous improvement. Provide coaching and training to AM teams and facilitators and ensure that they have the necessary skills and competencies to effectively carryout execute AM procedures. Track the AM key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics, and report on the results and achievements of AM initiatives. Lead and participate in AM projects and events and support the implementation of AM tools and techniques. Drive the culture change and employee engagement towards AM excellence and ownership. Develop an understanding of the Newell Brands Operating System pillar linkages.

Requirements

 Proven track record of leading and delivering successful AM results within site level teams and at enterprise program level. Strong knowledge and understanding of the AM principles, standards, methodologies and eight pillars of TPM. Excellent communication, presentation, and facilitation skills, with the ability to influence and collaborate with various stakeholders and levels of the organization. Highly analytical, data-driven, and problem-solving mindset, with the ability to identify and implement solutions. Self-motivated, proactive, and results-oriented, with the ability to work independently and as part of a team. Ability to work with and connect with all levels of employees. Strong planning & organizing skills. Demonstrated ability to handle multiple tasks and assignments simultaneously. Willingness and ability to travel up to 50% of the time within North America.

Education/Experience

 Bachelor's degree in engineering, manufacturing, or related field, preferred Certified AM Coach or Minimum 5 years of experience in TPM, lean manufacturing, or operational excellence roles, with a focus on AM.

_Newell Brands (NASDAQ: NWL) is a leading global consumer goods company with a strong portfolio of well-known brands, including Rubbermaid, Sharpie, Graco, Coleman, Rubbermaid Commercial Products, Yankee Candle, Paper Mate, FoodSaver, Dymo, EXPO, Elmer’s, Oster, NUK, Spontex and Campingaz. We are focused on delighting consumers by lighting up everyday moments. Newell Brands and its subsidiaries are Equal Opportunity Employers and comply with applicable employment laws. EOE/M/F/Vet/Disabled are encouraged to apply.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
